alert.note: Alert for Lake (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 7:56PM CST until March 04 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Des Plaines River near Gurnee affecting Lake IL County. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. Des Plaines River near Des Plaines affecting Cook County. Des Plaines River near Russell affecting Lake IL County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Des Plaines River from US-41 in Gurnee downstream to Townline Road in Vernon Hills, including the Gurnee gauge. * WHEN...From this evening to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Forest land inundated near the river in Gurnee. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Monday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 7.7 feet early Wednesday morning and remain steady through Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Tuesday afternoon.
